meanings.definition: The sound made by a clock or other timepiece.
meanings.sent1: I heard the tocking of the grandfather clock in the hallway.
meanings.sent2: The tocking of the wall clock reminded me that it was time for dinner.
meanings.sent3: The tocking of the alarm clock woke me up with a start.
meanings.sent4: The tocking of the pendulum clock echoed through the silent room.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic tocking of the metronome helped me keep pace while playing the piano.

meanings.definition: The act of ticking or making a ticking sound.
meanings.sent1: The tocking of the old watch was a comforting sound to him.
meanings.sent2: She could hear the tocking of the timer counting down in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The tocking of the broken clock was so irregular, it sounded like a song.
meanings.sent4: The tocking of rain on the roof was a soothing lullaby to the children.
meanings.sent5: The tocking of the geiger counter indicated the presence of radiation in the area.
